conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine the ratio of acceleration magnitudes during deceleration phases.
Deceleration phase for particle A is from t = 2t0 to t = 3t0; for particle B, it is from t = 5t0 to t = 6t0.
Initial and final velocities during deceleration: A starts at 2v0 and ends at 0; B starts at v0 and ends at 0.
Magnitude of acceleration for A is 2v0/t0; for B, it is v0/t0.
Ratio of magnitudes of acceleration is 2:1.
